content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, dtcolumn::Symbol) where T<:AbstractString
    df[!, :ym] = map(byrow -> Dates.format(byrow, "yyyymm"), df[:, dtcolumn])
    return df
end
```

This function assumes that the `DataFrame` has a column named `dt` and it will add a new column `ym` to the same data frame by extracting year and month from each element of the `dt` column. The format string "yyyymm" specifies that we want to display the date as an integer in the format "yyyymm", where "yyyy" is the year and "mm" is the month number (01-12).
